lock up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to make a building safe by locking the doors, especially at night
lock up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I’ll leave you to lock up.
Don’t forget to lock up the warehouse.
lock up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to put something in a safe place and lock the door, lid etc
lock up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if your money is locked up, you have put it into a business, investment etc and cannot easily move it or use it
lock up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a small prison where a criminal can be kept for a short time
lock up.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a garage that you can rent to keep cars, goods etc in
lock up.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to invest money or keep it in such a way that it not available to be used
lock up.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Mutual funds are an appropriate vehicle for income-seeking investors who don’t want to lock their money up.
lock up.translation[3].definitions[0].de: an agreement by which money is invested in such a way that it cannot be used for a period of time
lock up.translation[3].definitions[1].de: a period of time during which money is invested in such a way that it cannot be used
